ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p:
Help Apple create a world-class structural modeling and characterization team for the Battery organization. As a member of the Product Design Structural Analysis team, you will be responsible for FEA modeling and material characterization. You will be fully integrated with the Product Design team from the earliest stages, analyzing and informing the mechanical design of cutting-edge products. You will also work with cross-functional teams within Apple and with outside vendors to characterize the strength of raw materials and components.
The Battery Engineering Team at Apple produces high energy and highly reliable embedded battery systems for all product teams. Tightly integrated with Product Development, Operations, Industrial Design and Reliability Testing groups, the Battery Product Development team owns battery module development from initial system architecture through ramp.

ul.li: Must have the ability to work in an incredibly fast-paced environment
Must have a passion for creating innovative, high quality products
Experience in using good modeling practices including model validation techniques preferred
Experience in testing and failure modeling of different classes of materials are preferred
Functional areas: non-linear, thin structures, dynamics, Fatigue, multi-physics, Explicit (shock/drop), Failure prediction, CFD, Optimization, Topological Optimization, Frequency Response.
Tools: Abaqus CAE (must), Ansys Mechanical (must), LS-Dyna (must), Spaceclaim / DesignModeler, Hypermesh, Femap, NX Adv Simulation, Isight, Fesafe, Fluent, Star-CCM

div.p:
As a member of the Product Design Structural Analysis team, you will be responsible for FEA modeling and material characterization for all products. You will be fully integrated with the Product Design team from the earliest stages, analyzing and informing the mechanical design of cutting-edge products. You will also work with cross-functional teams within Apple and with outside vendors to characterize the strength of raw materials and components.
•Work with design teams and cross-functional teams, to understand CAE analysis requirements and clearly identify the related goals, scope and functionality limitations. •Use best in class tools and solvers to generate the necessary simulation models and results. •Work with test and reliability labs, to develop physical test methods, to gather necessary data for results validation. •Work with system teams, to collaborate on developing detailed sub-models to be used in assembly level simulations. •Develop optimized workflows and/or reusable templates for regularly required FEA simulations. •Develop and implement best practices. •Work with CAE vendors to drive the functionality improvements to better serve the CAE needs of the group. •Explore new analysis types and solutions, including topological optimization •Develop and maintain HPC infrastructure for supporting CAE activities.
